name: After the Gold | Documentary Screening on KGF
description: More than a century ago, large scale gold mining was begun at Kolar Gold Field, Mysore. At its peak, the mines employed 36,000 workers who braved the dangerous labour and built a new life in the mining camp. Today, many third and fourth generation gold miners face the threat of not just unemployment but displacement from the area they have made their own. This film is a tribute to the "labouring lions" of Kolar Gold Field, a historical reconstruction of their work, culture and rich political traditions.

name: Telling the story of KGF - Past, Present and Future
description:
How can we explore and convey the technological, historical, cultural, and political significance of Kolar Gold Fields, a town once thriving with gold mining, now left with remnants of its industrial past?
The gold mining industry in Kolar Gold Fields was established during the British Colonial rule in 1880. This labour-intensive industry grew rapidly into a highly profitable venture. Today, while the mining has long been stopped and the families of workers who toiled in the mines have moved on, the industrial equipment and the mining infrastructure stand as a stark reminder of a time when the mining work defined every life in the town. Join Writer - Filmmaker, Basav Biradar where he will discuss the technological, historical, cultural and political aspects of the KGF story and deliberate on what the many ways to tell the story of this remarkable town.

name: Cosmic Rays and the Early Days of Particle Physics Research in India
description:
What is the history of India’s research into the physics of elementary particles and of cosmic rays? How did this field begin and develop, from the times of the first world war all the way up to the 1960s when India was still a newly independent nation?
Sreerup Raychaudhuri, professor of theoretical physics at Banaras Hindu University, takes us through this journey — anchored by anecdotes from major personalities in history. Come dig into the Kolar Gold Fields’ role in the refinement of our understanding of physics and unearth the lessons that can be learnt from this historical exercise.

description: Join the Science Gallery Bengaluru team for a walkthrough of our ongoing exhibition, Sci560!
